books.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany

chapters.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:1
verses.text: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:2
verses.text: Hymn I.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:3
verses.text: Resp.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:4
verses.text: —To Thee be praise from Thy flock in the day of Thy Epiphany!  1.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:5
verses.text: The heavens He has renewed, for that fools worshipped all the luminaries:—He has renewed the earth, for that in Adam it was wasted.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:6
verses.text: —That which He fashioned has become new by His spittle:—and the All-Sufficing has restored bodies with souls.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:7
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:8
verses.text: Gather yourselves again ye—sheep and without labour receive cleansing!—for one needs not as Elisha—to bathe seven times in the river, nor again to be wearied as the priests are wearied with sprinklings.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:9
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:10
verses.text: Seven times Elisha purified himself in a mystery of the seven spirits;—and the hyssop and blood are a mighty symbol.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:11
verses.text: —There is no room for division;—He is not divided from the Lord of all Who is Son of the Lord of all.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:12
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:13
verses.text: Moses sweetened in Marah the waters that were bitter,—because the People complained and murmured:—Thus he gave a sign of baptism,—wherein the Lord of life makes sweet them that were bitter.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:14
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:15
verses.text: The cloud overshadowed and kept off the burning heat from the camp;—it showed a symbol of the Holy Spirit, which overshadows you in baptism—tempering the flaming fire that it harm not your bodies.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:16
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:17
verses.text: Through the sea the People then passed, and showed a symbol—of the baptism wherein ye were washed.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:18
verses.text: The People passed through that and believed not:—the Gentiles were baptized in this and believed and received the Holy Ghost.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:19
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:20
verses.text: The Word sent the Voice to proclaim before His Coming,—to prepare for Him the way by which He came,—and to betroth the Bride till He should come,—that she might be ready when He should come and take her from the water.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:21
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:22
verses.text: The voice of prophecy stirred the son of the barren woman,—and he went forth wandering in the desert and crying,—"Lo! the Son of the Kingdom comes!—prepare ye the way that He may enter and abide in your dwellings!"  9.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:23
verses.text: John cried, "Who comes after me, He is before me:—I am the Voice but not the Word;—I am the torch but not the Light;—the Star that rises before the Sun of Righteousness".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:24
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:25
verses.text: In the wilderness this John had cried and had said,—"Repent ye sinners of your evils,—and offer the fruits of repentance;—for lo! He comes that winnows the wheat from the tares".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:26
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:27
verses.text: The Lightgiver has prevailed and marked a mystery, by the degrees he ascended:—Lo! there are twelve days since he ascended,—and to-day this is the thirteenth:—a perfect mystery of Him, the Son, and His twelve!  12.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:28
verses.text: Darkness was overcome to make it manifest that Satan was overcome;—and the Light prevailed that he should proclaim—that the Firstborn triumphs: darkness was overcome—with the Dark Spirit, and our Light prevailed with the Lightgiver.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:29
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:30
verses.text: In the Height and the Depth the Son had two heralds.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:31
verses.text: —The star of light proclaimed Him from above;—John likewise preached Him from beneath:—two heralds, the earthly and the heavenly.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:32
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:33
verses.text: The star of light, contrary to nature, shone forth of a sudden;—less than the sun yet greater than the sun.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:34
verses.text: —Less was it than he in manifest light;—and greater than he in secret might because of its mystery.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:35
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:36
verses.text: The star of light shed its rays among them that were in darkness,—and guided them as though they were blind;—so that they came and met the great Light:—they gave offerings and received life and adored and departed.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:37
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:38
verses.text: The herald from above showed His Nature to be from the Most High;—likewise he that was from beneath showed His Body to be from humankind, mighty marvel!—that His Godhead and His Manhood by them were proclaimed!  17.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:39
verses.text: Thus whoso reckons Him as of earth, the star of light—will convince him that He is of Heaven: and whoso reckons Him as of spirit,—this John will convince him that He is also bodily.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:40
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:41
verses.text: John drew near with his parents and worshipped the Sun,—and brightness rested on His Face.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:42
verses.text: —He was not moved as when in the womb.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:43
verses.text: —Mighty marvel! that here he worships and there he leaped!  19.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:44
verses.text: The whole creation became for Him as one mouth and cried out concerning Him.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:45
verses.text: —The Magi cry out in their gifts;—the barren cry out with their children;—the star of light, lo! it cries out in the air, "Behold the Son of the King!"  20.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 1:46
verses.text: The heavens are opened, the waters break forth, the dove is in glory!—The voice of the Father is stronger than thunder,—as it utters the word, "This is My Beloved";—the Watchers brought the tidings, the children acclaimed Him in their Hosannas.

chapters.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:1
verses.text: Hymn II.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:2
verses.text: (Nearly identical with Hymn XIII.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:3
verses.text: On the Nativity.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:4
verses.text: )  (Resp.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:5
verses.text: —To Thee be praise Who in this feast makest all to exult!)  1.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:6
verses.text: In the time of the King whom they called by the name Semha—our Lord was manifested among the Hebrews.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:7
verses.text: —Thus Semha and Denha reigned together,—the King on earth and the Son on high—blessed be His power!  2.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:8
verses.text: In the days of the King who wrote down men in the taxing,—our Saviour came down and wrote down men in the Book of Life; He wrote and was written;—on high He wrote us, on earth He was written; glory to His Name!  3.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:9
verses.text: His Birth was in the days of the King whose name was Semha.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:10
verses.text: —Symbol and truth met one another;—King and King, Semha and Denha.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:11
verses.text: —That kingdom bore His Cross; blessed be He Who took it up!  4.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:12
verses.text: Thirty years abode He on earth in poverty.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:13
verses.text: —Voices of praise in all measures,—let us weave my brethren for our Lord's years;—thirty crowns for thirty years; Blessed be His number!  5.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:14
verses.text: In the first year, mistress of treasure and filled with blessings,—let the Cherubin give thanks with us, they who bear—the Son in glory Who gave up His glorious state,—and toiled and found the sheep that was lost;—to Him be thanksgiving!  6.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:15
verses.text: In the second year let the Seraphin multiply thanksgiving with us;—they who cried "Holy" to the Son, and turned and saw Him—among unbelievers put to shame.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:16
verses.text: —He endured scorn and taught us glory; to Him be glory given!  7.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:17
verses.text: In the third year let Michael and his hosts give thanks with us;—they who were wont to serve the Son on high,—and saw Him on earth doing service.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:18
verses.text: —He washed men's feet and cleansed men's souls; blessed be His meekness!  8.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:19
verses.text: In the fourth year let all the heavens give thanks with us! Too narrow for the Son it shall burst to see—how He lay on the couch of despised Zaccheus.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:20
verses.text: —He filled the couch and had filled the heavens;—to Him be thanksgiving!  9.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:21
verses.text: In the fifth year let the Sun that burns the earth with its heat—give thanks to our Sun that He straitened His largeness,—and tempered His force that the eye might endure to see Him;—the inward eye of a pure soul; blessed be His radiance!  10.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:22
verses.text: In the sixth year again let all the air give thanks with us,—in the vastness whereof all things exult.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:23
verses.text: —It saw its great Lord that He became—a little babe in a lowly bosom; blessed be His honour!  11.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:24
verses.text: In the seventh year let the clouds and winds sound the trumpet with us,—they whose dew sprinkles the faces of the flowers,—yet saw they the Son that He subdued His brightness,—and endured scorn and shameful spitting;—blessed be His salvation!  12.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:25
verses.text: Yet again in the eighth year let Creation give glory,—from whose fountain the fruits draw nurture.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:26
verses.text: —She adored when she saw the Son at the breast,—pure babe nurtured by pure milk; blessed be His good pleasure!  13.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:27
verses.text: In the ninth year let the earth give glory, which when her lap is watered then brings forth the root.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:28
verses.text: —She saw Mary an unwatered soil—whose fruit that she yielded is a mighty sea; to Him be exultation!  R.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:29
verses.text: , To Thee be glory, Son of the Lord of all, Who givest life to all!  14.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:30
verses.text: In the tenth year let Mount Sinai give glory, which melted—before its Lord! It saw against its Lord—stones taken up: but He took stones—to build the Church upon the Rock; blessed be His building!  15.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:31
verses.text: In the eleventh year let the great sea give thanks—to the hand of the Son Who measured it! And it wondered to see how He came down and was washed—in humble waters, He that cleanses Creation; blessed be His triumph!  16.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:32
verses.text: In the twelfth year let the holy Temple give thanks—which beheld the Child as He sat—among the elders: the doctors were silenced—as the Lamb of the feast bleated in the feast; blessed be His atonement!  17.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:33
verses.text: In the thirteenth year let diadems with us give thanks—to the King Who triumphed and was crowned—with a crown of thorns: He wove for man—a mighty diadem at His right hand; blessed be He That sent Him!  18.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:34
verses.text: In the fourteenth year let the Passover of Egypt give thanks—to the Passover that came and made passover for all,—and instead of Pharaoh overwhelmed Legion,—and instead of horsemen drowned demons; blessed be His retribution!  19.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:35
verses.text: In the fifteenth year let the lamb of the flock give thanks,—that our Lord slew it not as did Moses,—but redeemed by His Blood mankind.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:36
verses.text: —He the Shepherd of all died for all; blessed be He That begat Him!  20.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:37
verses.text: In the sixteenth year let the seed-corn in mystery give thanks—to that Husbandman Who gave His Body for seed—in a barren soil that corrupts all things.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:38
verses.text: —It proved fertile and yielded new bread; blessed be He that is pure!  21.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:39
verses.text: In the seventeenth year let the Vine give thanks to our Lord,—the Vineyard of truth, wherein souls were—as the scions.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:40
verses.text: He gave peace to this vineyard, but laid waste that vineyard which bare wild grapes; blessed be the Uprooter!  22.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:41
verses.text: In the eighteenth year let our leaven give thanks—to the leaven of truth that penetrates and draws—all minds and makes them to become—one mind in one doctrine; blessed be His doctrine!  23.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:42
verses.text: In the nineteenth year let the Salt give thanks for Thy Body.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:43
verses.text: —O blessed Babe it is the soul—that is the salt of the Body, and Faith—the salt of the soul whereby it is preserved; blessed be Thy preservation!  R.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:44
verses.text: , Glory to Thy Epiphany, O God and Man!  24.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:45
verses.text: In the twentieth year let temporal wealth with us give thanks,—which men that are perfect have cast off and abandoned—because of the "Woe"; and have gone and loved—poverty because of its beatitude; blessed be He Who desired it!  25.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:46
verses.text: In the one-and-twentieth year let the waters give thanks that were sweetened—in a mystery of the Son.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:47
verses.text: In the honey of Samson—the nations tasted bitterness therein that destroyed them:—they had life in the Cross that redeemed them; blessed be its pleasantness!  26.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:48
verses.text: In the two-and-twentieth year let arms and the sword give thanks,—for they could not slay our Adversary.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:49
verses.text: —Thou art He Who slew him as Thou art He Who restored—the ear that Simon's sword cut off; blessed be Thy healing!  27.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:50
verses.text: In the three-and-twentieth year let the ass likewise give thanks,—that gave the colt whereon He should ride;—He opens likewise the mouth of wild asses,—the offspring gave Him praise; blessed be the praise of Thee!  28.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:51
verses.text: In the four-and-twentieth year let wealth give thanks to the Son!—Treasures were amazed at the Lord of treasures,—how He grew up among the poor.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:52
verses.text: —He made Himself poor that He might make all rich; blessed be His participation!  29.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:53
verses.text: In the five-and-twentieth year let Isaac give thanks to the Son—Who in the mount saved him from the knife,—and became in his stead the lamb to be slain.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:54
verses.text: —The mortal escaped, and He died Who gives life to all; blessed be His offering!  30.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:55
verses.text: In the six-and-twentieth year let Moses with us give thanks,—who feared and fled from the slayers;—let him give thanks to the Son, for He it was Who on His feet—entered Sheol and spoiled it and came forth; blessed be His Resurrection!  [31.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:56
verses.text: In the seven-and-twentieth year let the eloquent Orators—give thanks to the Son, for they could not find—means whereby we should prevail in our judgment:—He was silent in judgment and made our judgment prevail; to Him be applause!]  32.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:57
verses.text: In the seven and twentieth year let all Judges give thanks,—who as being just have put to death illdoers;—let them give thanks to the Son Who instead of the evil—died as being good, though He was Son of the Just One; blessed be His mercies!  33.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:58
verses.text: In the eight-and-twentieth year let them give thanks to the Son,—all the mighty men who saved us not—from the captors.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:59
verses.text: One is to be worshipped,—Who was slain and laid hold and saved us; blessed be His deliverance!  34.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:60
verses.text: In the nine-and-twentieth year let Job with us give thanks,—who bare sufferings in his own behalf:—but our Lord bare on our behalf—the spitting and the stripes, the thorns and the nails; blessed is His compassion!  35.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 2:61
verses.text: In the year that is the thirtieth let them give thanks with us;—the dead that have lived through His dying,—the living that were converted in His Crucifixion,—and the height and the depth that have been reconciled in Him! Blessed be He and His Father!.

chapters.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:1
verses.text: Hymn III.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:2
verses.text: (Resp.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:3
verses.text: —Christ with chrism, lo! He is sealing the newborn lambs in His flock!)  1.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:4
verses.text: Christ and chrism are conjoined; the secret with the visible is mingled: the chrism anoints visibly,—Christ seals secretly, the lambs newborn and spiritual, the prize of His twofold victory; for He engendered it of the chrism, and He gave it birth of the water.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:5
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:6
verses.text: How exalted are your Orders! For she that was a sinner anointed, as a handmaid, the feet of her Lord.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:7
verses.text: But for you, as though His minister, Christ by the hand of His servants, seals and anoints your bodies.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:8
verses.text: It befits Him the Lord of the flock, that in His own person He seal His sheep.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:9
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:10
verses.text: Since then she, that sinner, stood in need of forgiveness, the anointing was for her an offering, and by it her love reconciled her Lord.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:11
verses.text: But you who are the flock, among the profane and unbelievers, the Truth by the chrism is your seal, to separate you from the strayed.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:12
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:13
verses.text: From the peoples he separated the People, by the former seal of circumcision; but by the seal of anointing, the peoples He separates from the People.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:14
verses.text: When the peoples were in error, the People He separated from the peoples; now when the People has erred from Him, He separates the peoples from thence.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:15
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:16
verses.text: Of the dust of the pure soil, Naaman bore away and returned to his place; that he by this holy dust, might be separated and known from the unclean.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:17
verses.text: The chrism of Christ separates, the sons of the mystery from strangers: and by it they that are within are separated, and known from them that are without.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:18
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:19
verses.text: The oil which Elijah multiplied, might be tasted with the mouth; for the cruse was that of the widow, it was not that of the chrism.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:20
verses.text: The oil of our Lord that is in the cruse, it is not food for the mouth: the sinner that was a wolf without, it makes him a lamb in the flock.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:21
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:22
verses.text: The chrism of the meek and lowly One, changes the stubborn to be like its Lord.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:23
verses.text: The Gentiles were wolves and feared, the severe rod of Moses.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:24
verses.text: Lo! the chrism seals them and makes, a flock of sheep out of the wolves! And the wolves that had fled from the rod, lo! they have taken refuge in the Cross!  8.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:25
verses.text: The leaf of olive arrived, brought as a figure of the anointing; the sons of the Ark rejoiced to greet it, for it bore good tidings of deliverance.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:26
verses.text: Thus also ye rejoiced to greet it, even this holy anointing.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:27
verses.text: The bodies of sinners were glad in it, for it brought good tidings of deliverance.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:28
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:29
verses.text: The oil again that Jacob poured, upon the stone when he sealed it, that it should be between him and God, and that he might offer there his tithes; lo! in it is a symbol of your bodies, how by chrism they are sealed as holy, and become temples for God, where He shall be served by your sacrifices.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:30
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:31
verses.text: When Moses had sealed and anointed, the sons of Aaron the Levite, the fire consumed their bodies; the fire spared their vestments.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:32
verses.text: But ye my brethren blessed are ye, for the fire of grace has come down, has consumed utterly your offences, and cleansed and hallowed your bodies!  11.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:33
verses.text: As for the anointing of Aaron my brethren, it was the vile blood of beasts, that it sprinkled in the horns of the altar.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:34
verses.text: The anointing of truth is this; wherein the living and all-lifegiving Blood, is sprinkled inwardly in your bodies, is mingled in your understandings, is infused through your inmost chambers.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:35
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:36
verses.text: The anointed priests used to offer, the slain bodies of beasts; Ye, O anointed and excelling, your offerings are your own bodies.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:37
verses.text: The anointed Levites offered, the inward parts taken, from beasts: ye have excelled the Levites, for your hearts ye have Consecrated.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:38
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:39
verses.text: The anointing of the People was—a foreshadowing of Christ; their rod a mystery of the Cross; their lamb a type of the Only begotten; their tabernacle a mystery of your Churches; their circumcision a sign of your sealing.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:40
verses.text: Under the shadow of your goodly thing, sat the People of old.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:41
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:42
verses.text: Thus the truth is likened, to a great shadowing tree: it cast its shade on the People; it struck its root among the peoples.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:43
verses.text: The People abode under its shadows, whose shadows were its mysteries; but the Gentiles lodged on its bough, and plucked and ate of its fruits.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:44
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:45
verses.text: As for the anointing of Saul to be king; the sweeter was its savour, so much fouler was the savour of his heart.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:46
verses.text: The Spirit struck him and fled.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:47
verses.text: Your anointing which ye have is greater; for your minds are censers, in your temples the Spirit exults, a chamber forever shall ye be unto Him.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:48
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:49
verses.text: As for the anointing of David my brethren; the Spirit came down and made sweet savour, in the heart of the man wherein He delighted; the savour of his heart was as the savour of his action.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:50
verses.text: The Spirit dwelt in him and made song in him.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:51
verses.text: Your anointing which ye have is greater, for Father and Son and Holy Ghost, have moved and come down to dwell in you.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:52
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:53
verses.text: When the leper of old was cleansed, the priest used to seal him with oil, and to lead him to the waterspring.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:54
verses.text: The type has passed and the truth is come; lo! with chrism have ye been sealed, in baptism ye are perfected, in the flock ye are intermixed, from the Body ye are nourished.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:55
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:56
verses.text: What leper when he has been cleansed, turns again and desires his leprosy? Ye have put off transgressions—forsake it! None puts on the leprosy he had put off.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:57
verses.text: It has fallen and sunk—let it not be drawn out! It is wasted and worn—let it not be renewed! Let not corruption come out upon you, whom the chrism of Christ has anointed!  19.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:58
verses.text: The vessel moulded of clay, gains beauty from the water, receives strength from the fire; but if it slips it is ruined, it cannot be afresh renewed.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:59
verses.text: Ye are vessels of grace; be ye ware of it, even of justice, for it grants not two renewals.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:60
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:61
verses.text: How like are ye in comparison, with the Prophet whom the fish yielded up! The Devourer has given you back for he was constrained, by the Power Which constrained the fish.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:62
verses.text: Jonah was for you as a mirror, since not again did the fish swallow him, let not again the Devourer swallow you: being yielded up be ye like Jonah!  21.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:63
verses.text: Goodly ointment on the head of our Lord did Mary pour; its savour was fragrant through all the house.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:64
verses.text: Likewise the savour of your anointing, has been fragrant and perfumed the heavens, to the Watchers on high; doing pleasure to Satan its savour is overpowering; to God its odour is sweet.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:65
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:66
verses.text: The crowds in the desert were like unto sheep that have no shepherd.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:67
verses.text: The Merciful became their shepherd, and multiplied to them the pasture of bread.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:68
verses.text: Yea, blessed are ye that are perfect, that are sealed as lambs of Christ, that of His Body and Blood are made worthy; the Pastor Himself is become pasture for you!  23.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:69
verses.text: Out of water He made the wine, He gave it for drink to the youths in the feast.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:70
verses.text: For you who are keeping the fast, better is the unction than drink.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:71
verses.text: In His wine the betrothed are wedded, by His oil the wedded are sanctified.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:72
verses.text: By His wine is union; by His oil sanctification.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:73
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:74
verses.text: The sheep of Christ leaped for joy, to receive the seal of life, that ensign of kings which has ever put sin to flight.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:75
verses.text: The Wicked by Thy ensign is routed, iniquities by Thy sign are scattered.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:76
verses.text: Come, ye sheep, receive your seal, which puts to flight them that devour you!  25.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:77
verses.text: Come, ye lambs, receive your seal, for it is truth that is your seal! This is the seal that separates, them of the household from strangers.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:78
verses.text: The steel circumcised alike, the gainsayers and the sons of Hagar.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:79
verses.text: If circumcision be the sign of the sheep, lo! by it the goats are signed.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:80
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:81
verses.text: But ye, who are the new flock, have put off the doings of wolves, and as lambs are made like to the Lamb.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:82
verses.text: One by changing has changed all; the Lamb to the wolves gave Himself to be slain; the wolves rushed and devoured Him and became lambs; for the Shepherd was changed into a Lamb; likewise the wolf forgot his nature.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:83
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:84
verses.text: Look on me also in Thy mercy! be not branded on me the seal, of the goats the sons of the left hand! let not Thy sheep become a goat! For though to justify myself I sufficed not, yet to be a sinner I willed not.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:85
verses.text: Turn thine eyes, O my Lord, from what I have done, and seek not only what I have willed.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:86
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 3:87
verses.text: From them that write and them that preach, from them that hear and them that are sealed, let glory go up to Christ, and through Him to His Father be exaltation! He Who gives words to them that speak, and gives voice to them that preach, has given understanding to them that hear, and consecrates chrism for him that is sealed.

chapters.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:1
verses.text: Hymn IV.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:2
verses.text: (Resp.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:3
verses.text: —Blessed be He that blots out in water misdeeds that are without measure!)  1.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:4
verses.text: Descend my sealed brethren, put ye on our Lord,—and be rejoined to His lineage, for He is son of a great lineage,—as He has said in His Word.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:5
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:6
verses.text: From on high is His Nature, and from beneath His Vesture.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:7
verses.text: —Each that puts off his vesture, commingled is that vesture, with His Vesture forever.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:8
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:9
verses.text: Ye too in the water, receive from him the vesture,—that wastes not or is lost for it is the vesture that vests—them that are vested in it forever.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:10
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:11
verses.text: But the blessed Priest, is daysman between two:—the covenant shall be made before Him, He is daysman of his Lord,—and surety on our part.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:12
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:13
verses.text: The Godhead in the water, lo! has mingled His leaven;—for the creatures of dust, that leaven raises up,—and the Godhead joins them.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:14
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:15
verses.text: For it is the leaven of the Lord, that can glide into the bondman,—and raise him to freedom; it has joined the bondman to the lineage,—of Him the Lord of all.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:16
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:17
verses.text: For the bondman who has put on Him, Who makes all free in the waters,—though bondman he be on earth, is son of the free on high,—for freedom he has put on.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:18
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:19
verses.text: The freeman who has put on, that Angel in the waters,—is as the fellow of servants, that he may be made like to the Lord,—Who became bondman unto bondmen.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:20
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:21
verses.text: He Who enriches all came down, and put on poverty,—that He might divide to the poor, the stores that were hidden,—out of the treasure-house of the water.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:22
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:23
verses.text: The lowly one again that has put on, the Giver of all greatness, in the water,—even though he be base in the sight of fools, yet is great in the sight of the Watchers,—for that he is clad in greatness.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:24
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:25
verses.text: For like as He Who is great, Who became lowly in His love,—by the unbelievers was persecuted, and by the Watchers was worshipped,—was made lowly and makes the lowly great.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:26
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:27
verses.text: Thus let him be lowly who is great, that in him the lowly may be great:—Let us be like to Him Who is greater than all, Who became less than all:—He was made lowly, and makes all men great.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:28
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:29
verses.text: The meek man who has put on Him Who is great, in the water,—though humble be his countenance, very great is his discernment,—for He Who is exalted above all dwells in him.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:30
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:31
verses.text: For who could be found to despise the bush of thorn,—the despised and humble, wherein the Majesty in fire,—made its dwelling within?  15.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:32
verses.text: Who again could be found, to despise Moses,—the meek and slow of speech,—when that excelling glory—dwelt upon his meekness?  16.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:33
verses.text: They that despised him despised his Lord; the wicked that despised him—the earth swallowed up in anger; the Levites who scorned Him,—the fire devoured in fury.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:34
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:35
verses.text: Of Him Christ commanded, "Thou shalt not call him Raca," who is baptized and has put Him on; for whoso despises the despised, despises with him the Mighty.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:36
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:37
verses.text: In Eden and in the world, are parables of our Lord;—and what tongue can gather, the similitudes of His mysteries?—for He is figured all of Him in all things.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:38
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:39
verses.text: In the Scriptures He is written of; on Nature He is impressed;—His crown is figured in kings, in prophets His truth, His atonement in priests.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:40
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:41
verses.text: In the rod was He of Moses, and in the hyssops of Aaron,—and in the crown of David: to the prophets pertains His similitude, to the Apostles His Gospel.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:42
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:43
verses.text: Revelations beheld Thee, proverbs looked for Thee,—mysteries expected Thee, similitudes saluted Thee, parables showed types of Thee.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:44
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:45
verses.text: The Covenant of Moses looked forward to the Gospel:—all things of old time, flew on and alighted thereon, in the new Covenant.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:46
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:47
verses.text: Lo! the prophets have poured out on Him, their glorious mysteries;—the priests and kings have poured out upon Him, their wonderful types:—they all have poured them out on all of Him.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:48
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:49
verses.text: Christ overcame and surpassed, by His teachings the mysteries,—by His interpretations the parables; as the sea into its midst—receives all streams.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:50
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 4:51
verses.text: For Christ is the sea, and He can receive—the fountains and brooks, the rivers and streams, that flow from the midst of the Scriptures.

chapters.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:1
verses.text: Hymn V.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:2
verses.text: (Resp.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:3
verses.text: —Blessed be He that ordained baptism, for the atonement of the sons of Adam!)  1.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:4
verses.text: Descend, my brethren, put on from the waters of baptism the Holy Spirit;—be joined with the spirits that minister to the Godhead!  2.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:5
verses.text: For lo! He is the fire that secretly, seals also His flock,—by the Three spiritual Names, wherein the Evil One is put to flight.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:6
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:7
verses.text: John when he cried and said "This is the Lamb of God,"—thereby showed concerning the Gentiles that they are Abraham's children.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:8
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:9
verses.text: This is he that testified of our Saviour, that with fire and the Spirit He should baptize.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:10
verses.text: —Lo! the fire and the Spirit, my brethren, in the baptism of truth.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:11
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:12
verses.text: For greater is Baptism than Jordan that little river;—for that in streams of water and oil, the misdeeds of all men are washed out.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:13
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:14
verses.text: Elisha by seven times washing, cleansed Naaman's leprosy:—in Baptism are cleansed the secret misdeeds in the soul.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:15
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:16
verses.text: Moses baptized the People in the midst of the sea, yet availed not—to wash their heart within, that was full of the defilements of misdeeds.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:17
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:18
verses.text: Lo! the priest in the likeness of Moses purges the defilements of the soul;—and with oil of anointing, lo! he seals new lambs for the Kingdom.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:19
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:20
verses.text: Samuel anointed David to be king among the People:—but lo! the priest anoints you to be heirs in the Kingdom.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:21
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:22
verses.text: For with the armour that David put on, after the anointing he fought—and laid low the giant who sought to subdue Israel.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:23
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:24
verses.text: Lo! again in the chrism of Christ, and in the armour that is from the water—the haughtiness of the Evil One is humbled, who sought to subdue the Gentiles.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:25
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:26
verses.text: By the water that flowed from the rock, the thirst of the People was quenched.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:27
verses.text: Lo! in the fountain of Christ, the thirst of the peoples is quenched.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:28
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:29
verses.text: The rod of Moses opened the rock, and the streams flowed forth; and they were refreshed by its draught, who had grown faint with thirst.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:30
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:31
verses.text: Lo! from the side of Christ flowed the stream that bestowed life.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:32
verses.text: —The Gentiles drank that were weary, and in it forgot their pains.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:33
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 5:34
verses.text: With Thy dew besprinkle my vileness, and my crimes in Thy blood shall be atoned!—And I shall be, O my Lord, at Thy right hand, and with Thy Saints I shall be joined!.

chapters.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:1
verses.text: Hymn VI.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:2
verses.text: (Resp.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:3
verses.text: —Blessed be He Who was baptized that He might baptize you, that ye should be absolved from your offences.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:4
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:5
verses.text: The Spirit came down from on high,—and hallowed the waters by His brooding.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:6
verses.text: —In the baptism of John,—He passed by the rest and abode on One:—but now He has descended and abode,—on all that are born of the water.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:7
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:8
verses.text: Out of all that John baptized,—on One it was that the Spirit dwelt:—but now He has flown and come down,—that He may dwell on the many;—and as each after each comes up,—He loves him and abides on him.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:9
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:10
verses.text: A marvel it is that surpasses all!—To the water He went down and was baptized.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:11
verses.text: —The seas declared it blessed,—that river wherein Thou wast baptized:—even the waters that were in heaven envied,—because they were not worthy to be Thy bath.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:12
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:13
verses.text: A marvel it is, O my Lord, now also,—that while the fountains are full of water,—it is the water of baptism,—that alone is able to atone.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:14
verses.text: —Mighty is the water in the seas,—yet is it too weak for atonement.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:15
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:16
verses.text: Thy might, O my Lord, if it abides,—within the humble it exalts him;—like as royalty if it abide—within the desert gives it peace.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:17
verses.text: —Water by Thy might has triumphed—over sin, for Life has encompassed it.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:18
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:19
verses.text: The sheep exulted when they saw—the hand draw nigh to baptize them.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:20
verses.text: —Receive, O ye sheep, your sealing; enter and be mingled in the flock!—for more than over all the flock,—over you rejoice the Watchers to-day.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:21
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:22
verses.text: The Angels and the Watchers rejoice—over that which is born of the Spirit and of water:—they rejoice that by fire and by the Spirit,—the corporeal have become spiritual.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:23
verses.text: —The Seraphins who sing "Holy" rejoice,—that they who are made holy have been increased.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:24
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:25
verses.text: For lo! the Angels rejoice—over one sinner if he repent:—how much more do they now rejoice—that in all churches and congregations,—lo! Baptism is bringing forth—the heavenly from the earthly!  9.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:26
verses.text: The baptized when they come up are sanctified;—the sealed when they go down are pardoned.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:27
verses.text: —They who come up have put on glory;—they who go down have cast off sin.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:28
verses.text: —Adam put off his glory in a moment;—ye have been clothed with glory in a moment.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:29
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:30
verses.text: A house that is of dust when it has fallen,—by means of water can be renewed:—the body of Adam that was of dust,—which had fallen by water has been renewed.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:31
verses.text: —Lo! the priests as builders—afresh renew your bodies.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:32
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:33
verses.text: A great marvel is this of the wool,—that it can take every dye,—as the mind takes every discourse.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:34
verses.text: —By the name of its dye it is called;—as ye who were—baptized when "Hearers,"—have gained the name of "Recipients".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:35
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:36
verses.text: The common waters he sanctified—even Elisha through the Name that is secret.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:37
verses.text: —In them washed the leper openly,—and was cleansed by the Power that is secret:—the leprosy was done away in the water, as transgressions in Baptism.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:38
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:39
verses.text: To-day, lo! your offences are blotted out,—and your names are written down.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:40
verses.text: —The priest blots out in the water;—and Christ writes down in Heaven.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:41
verses.text: —By the blotting out and the writing down—lo! doubled is your rejoicing.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:42
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:43
verses.text: Lo! mercy has dawned to-day;—and from bound to bound it stretches:—the sun has sunk and mercy has dawned.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:44
verses.text: —Justice has drawn in her wrath; Grace has spread forth her love,—lo! she pardons and quickens freely.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:45
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:46
verses.text: The sheep that beforetime were in the fold—lo! they hasten forth to greet—the new lambs that have been added to it.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:47
verses.text: —They are white and are clad in white;—within and without white are your bodies as your vestments.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:48
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:49
verses.text: From every mouth "Blessed are ye,"—on every side "Blessed are ye".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:50
verses.text: —Sin from you is driven out,—and the Holy Spirit on you is dwelling.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:51
verses.text: —The Evil One is become sad of countenance;—the Good God makes glad your countenance.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:52
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:53
verses.text: The gift that ye have received freely,—cease not from watching over it:—this pearl if it shall be lost—cannot again be sought out,—for it is like to virginity—which if it be lost is not to be found.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:54
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:55
verses.text: May ye from all defilement—be kept by the power of your white robes!—and he whose freedom has defiled itself—may it be able to wash itself clean by his weeping!—For me who am servant of the community—may the supplication of the community win pardon!  19.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:56
verses.text: To the author who has toiled in words,—be reconciliation in rest!—to the teacher who has toiled with voice,—be forgiveness through grace!—to the priest who has toiled in baptizing,—let there come the crown of righteousness!  20.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 6:57
verses.text: From every mouth with one consent,—of those beneath and those above,—Watchers, Cherubin, and Seraphin,—the baptized, the sealed, and the hearers,—let each of us cry aloud and say,—"Glory to the Lord of our feasts!".

chapters.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:1
verses.text: Hymn VII.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:2
verses.text: (Resp.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:3
verses.text: —Blessed is He Who atoned your sins, that ye might receive His Body worthily!)  1.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:4
verses.text: The flock of Jacob came down—and stood round the well of water.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:5
verses.text: —In the water they put on the similitude of the wood that was covered by it.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:6
verses.text: —Mysteries these and types of the Cross,—wherein the parables are interpreted.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:7
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:8
verses.text: There are shown in these rods similitudes,—and in the sheep, parables.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:9
verses.text: —The Cross in the rods is figured, and in the sheep the souls of men.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:10
verses.text: —His wood was a mystery of our Wood;—likewise his sheep a mystery of our flock.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:11
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:12
verses.text: The sheep of Christ rejoice,—and stand round the laver of baptism;—in the water they put on the likeness—of the living and goodly Cross—whereon gaze all things created,—and all of it is stamped on them all.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:13
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:14
verses.text: At the well Rebecca received—in her ears and hands the jewels.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:15
verses.text: —The Spouse of Christ has put on—precious things that are from the water:—on her hand the living Body,—and in her ears the promises.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:16
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:17
verses.text: Moses drew water and watered the sheep—of Jethro the priest of sin.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:18
verses.text: —But our Shepherd has baptized His sheep—Who is the high priest of truth.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:19
verses.text: —At the well the flocks were dumb,—but here the sheep have speech.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:20
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:21
verses.text: The People passed through the water and were baptized:—the People came up on dry land and became as heathen.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:22
verses.text: —The Commandment was savourless in their ears;—the manna corrupted in their vessels.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:23
verses.text: —Eat ye the living Body,—the medicine of life that gives life to all!  7.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:24
verses.text: To the sons of Lot Moses said,—"Give us water for money,—let us only pass by through your border".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:25
verses.text: —They refused the way, and the temporal water.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:26
verses.text: —Lo! the living water freely given,—and the path that leads to Eden!  8.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:27
verses.text: From the water Gideon chose for himself—the men who were victorious in the battle.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:28
verses.text: —Ye have gone down to the victorious waters:—come ye up and triumph in the fight!—receive from the water atonement,—and from the fight the crowning!  9.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:29
verses.text: Ye baptized, receive your lamps,—like the lamps of the house of Gideon;—conquer the darkness by your lamps,—and the silence by your hosannas!—Gideon likewise in the battle—triumphed by the shout and the flame.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:30
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:31
verses.text: David the King longed after—the water of the well, and they brought it him;—but he drank it not, for he saw that with blood of men it was bought.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:32
verses.text: —In the midst of the water ye have revelled—that was bought with the blood of God.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:33
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:34
verses.text: Out of Edom the prophet saw—God coming as one that presses the grapes.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:35
verses.text: —He made ready the winepress of wrath,—He trod down the peoples and delivered the People.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:36
verses.text: —He has turned and ordained Baptism;—the peoples live, the People is come to nought.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:37
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:38
verses.text: In the river Jeremiah buried—the linen girdle that was marred;—and [the People] waxed old and decayed.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:39
verses.text: —…—The peoples that were decayed and marred,—by the waters have been clad in newness.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:40
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:41
verses.text: In Siloam, the blessed stream—the priests anointed Solomon.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:42
verses.text: —His youth was had in honour;—his old age was despised.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:43
verses.text: —Through the pure waters ye have been clad—in the purity of Heaven.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:44
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:45
verses.text: The fleece that was dry from the dew,—Jerusalem was figured in it:—the bason that was filled with water,—Baptism was figured in it.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:46
verses.text: —That was dry after the manner of its type;—this was full after the manner of its symbol.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:47
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:48
verses.text: The wearied body in water—washes and is refreshed from its toil.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:49
verses.text: —Lo! the laver in which are hidden—refreshing and life and delights.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:50
verses.text: —In it wearied Adam had rest—who brought labour into the creation.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:51
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:52
verses.text: The fountain of sweat in the body—is set to protect against fever:—the fountain of Baptism—is set to protect against the Flame.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:53
verses.text: —This is the water that avails—for the quenching of Gehenna.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:54
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:55
verses.text: He who journeys through the desert,—as armour takes to himself water—against all-conquering thirst.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:56
verses.text: —Go ye down to the fountain of Christ,—receive life in your members,—as armour against death.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:57
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:58
verses.text: Again, the diver brings up—out of the sea the pearl.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:59
verses.text: —Be baptized and bring up from the water—purity that therein is hidden,—the pearl that is set as a jewel—in the crown of the Godhead.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:60
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:61
verses.text: Sweet water in his vessel—the seaman lays up as a store;—in the midst of the sea he lays up and keeps it, the sweet in the midst of the bitter.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:62
verses.text: —So amidst the floods of sin,—keep ye the water of Baptism.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:63
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:64
verses.text: The woman of Samaria said to our Lord,—"Lo! verily the well is deep".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:65
verses.text: —Baptism though it be high,—in its mercy has stooped down with us:—for the atonement is from above—that has come down unto sinners.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:66
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:67
verses.text: "He that drinks the water that I shall give him,—verily never again shall he thirst".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:68
verses.text: —For this holy Baptism,—for it be ye athirst, my beloved;—never again shall ye be athirst,—so that ye should come to another baptism.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:69
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:70
verses.text: In the baptism of Siloam—the blind man washed, and his eyeballs—were opened and enlightened by the water;—he cast off the darkness that was on them.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:71
verses.text: —The hidden darkness ye have cast off;—from the water ye have been clad in light.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:72
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:73
verses.text: His hands Pilate washed—that he might not be of them that slew.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:74
verses.text: —Ye have bathed your bodies,—your hands together with your mouths.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:75
verses.text: —Go in and be of them that eat,—for this medicine of life gives life to all.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:76
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:77
verses.text: "Come after Me and verily I will make you—fishers of men".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:78
verses.text: —For instead of a draught of that which perishes,—they fished for the draught that is forever.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:79
verses.text: —They who had taken fishes for death,—baptized and gave life to them that were to die.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:80
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:81
verses.text: An hundred and fifty fishes were taken—by Simon's net from the water;—but there were taken by his preaching,—out of the bosom of Baptism,—ten thousands and thousands of men,—a draught of the sons of the Kingdom.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:82
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:83
verses.text: Lo! our priest as a fisher—over the scanty water is standing;—he has taken thence a great draught—of every shape and of every kind;—he has drawn up the draught to bring it near—to the King of kings, most high.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:84
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:85
verses.text: Simon took the fishes and drew them up,—and they were brought near before our Lord:—Our priest has taken from out of the water,—by the Hand which he received from Simon,—virgins and chaste men who are brought near—in the festival of the Lord of feasts.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:86
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:87
verses.text: In Thy mercy I adjure Thee pardon me,—for in mercy Thou too hast sworn,—Rabboni, "In the death of him that dieth,—I have no pleasure, but in his life".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 7:88
verses.text: —Thou hast sworn and I have adjured:—O Thou Who hast sworn, pardon him who has adjured!.

chapters.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:1
verses.text: Hymn VIII.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:2
verses.text: (Resp.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:3
verses.text: —Happy are ye whose bodies have been made to shine!)  1.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:4
verses.text: God in His mercy stooped and came down,—to mingle His compassion with the water,—and to blend the nature of His majesty—with the wretched bodies of men.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:5
verses.text: —He made occasion by the water—to come down and to dwell in us:—like to the occasion of mercy—when He came down and dwelt in the womb:—O the mercies of God—Who seeks for Himself all occasions to dwell in us!  2.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:6
verses.text: To the cave in Horeb He stooped and came down,—and on Moses He caused His majesty to dwell;—He imparted His glorious splendour to mortals.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:7
verses.text: —There was therein a figure of Baptism:—He Who came down and dwelt in it,—tempers within the water—the might of His majesty,—that He may dwell in the feeble.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:8
verses.text: —On Moses dwelt the Breath,—and on you the Perfecting of Christ.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:9
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:10
verses.text: That might then none could endure;—not Moses chief of deliverers,—nor Elijah chief of zealots;—and the Seraphin too vail their faces,—for it is the might that subdues all.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:11
verses.text: —His mercy mingled gentleness—in the water and by the oil;—that mankind in its weakness—might be able to stand before Him—when covered by the water and the oil.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:12
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:13
verses.text: The captive priests again in the well—hid and concealed the fire of the sanctuary,—a mystery of that glorified fire—which the Highpriest mingles in Baptism.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:14
verses.text: —The priests took up of the mire,—and on the altar they sprinkled it;—for its fire, the fire of that well,—with the mire had been mingled;—a mystery of our bodies which in the water—with the fire of the Holy Spirit have been mingled.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:15
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:16
verses.text: The famous Three in Babylon—in the furnace of fire were baptized, and came forth;—they went in and bathed in the flood of flame, they were buffeted by the blazing billows.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:17
verses.text: —There was sprinkled on them there—the dew that fell from heaven;—it loosed from off them there—the bonds of the earthly king.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:18
verses.text: —Lo! the famous Three went in and found a fourth in the furnace.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:19
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:20
verses.text: That visible fire that triumphed outwardly,—pointed to the fire of the Holy Ghost,—which is mingled, lo! and hidden in the water.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:21
verses.text: —In the flame Baptism is figured,—in that blaze of the furnace.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:22
verses.text: —Come, enter, be baptized, my brethren,—for lo! it looses the bonds;—for in it there dwells and is hidden—the Daysman of God,—Who in the furnace was the fourth.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:23
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:24
verses.text: Two words again our Lord spake—which in one voice agree in unison:—He said, "I am come to send fire,"—and again, "I have a baptism to be baptized with".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:25
verses.text: —By the fire of Baptism is quenched the fire,—that which the Evil One had kindled:—and the water of Baptism has overcome—those waters of contention—by which he had made trial—of Joseph who conquered and was crowned.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:26
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:27
verses.text: Lo! the pure fire of our Redeemer—which he kindled in mankind of His mercy!—Through His fire He quenched that fire—which had been kindled in the defiled and sinful.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:28
verses.text: —This is the fire wherein the thorns—are burnt up and the tares.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:29
verses.text: —But happy are your bodies—that have been baptized in the fire—which has consumed your thickets,—and by it your seeds have sprung up to heaven!  9.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:30
verses.text: Jeremiah in the womb He sanctified and taught.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:31
verses.text: —But if the lowly bosom of wedlock—was sanctified in conceiving and bringing him forth,—how much more shall Baptism sanctify—its conception and its bringing forth—of them that are pure and spiritual!—For there, within the womb—is the conception of all men;—but here, out of the water,—is the birth whereof the spiritual are worthy.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:32
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:33
verses.text: For Jeremiah though sanctified in the womb,—they took up nails and cast him into the pit.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:34
verses.text: —Holy was the prophet in his befoulment,—for clean was his heart though he was in the mire.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:35
verses.text: —Be ye afraid, my brethren—for lo! to-day is washed away—your secret befoulment,—and the abomination of your sins.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:36
verses.text: —Turn not again to uncleanness,—for there is but one cleansing of your bodies!  11.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:37
verses.text: The presumptuous who is baptized and again sins,—is as the serpent that casts its slough and again puts it on, that is renewed and made young, and turns again——putting on anew its skin of old;—for the serpent does not—cast off its nature.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:38
verses.text: —Cast ye off the tempter—the corrupter of souls,—even the old man;—let it not make old—the newness ye have put on!  12.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:39
verses.text: Elisha cast the wood into the water, and made the heavy float and the light sink:—their natures were exchanged in the water.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:40
verses.text: —There a new thing came to pass not according to nature.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:41
verses.text: —How much easier then, O Lord,—is this for Thy grace; that in the water should sink—transgression which is heavy,—but that the soul which is light—should be drawn forth and raised up on high!  13.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:42
verses.text: Joshua, son of Nun, on Jericho—laid a curse on its walls and a doom on its fountains.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:43
verses.text: —They whom Joshua cursed to their destruction,—again in the mystery of Jesus have been blessed.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:44
verses.text: —There was cast into them salt,—and they were healed and sweetened:—a mystery of this salt,—the sweet salt that came from Mary,—that was mingled in the water,—whereby was healed the noisomeness of our plagues.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:45
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:46
verses.text: Lo! quiet waters are before you,—holy and tranquil and pleasant;—for they are not the waters of contention—that cast Joseph into the dungeon;—nor yet are they the waters,—those waters of strife,—beside which the people strove,—and gainsaid in the wilderness.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:47
verses.text: —There are waters whereby—there is reconciliation made with Heaven.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:48
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:49
verses.text: Hagar saw the spring of water,—and from it she gave drink to her forward son, him who became as a wild ass in the wilderness.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:50
verses.text: —Instead of that fountain of water is Baptism.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:51
verses.text: —In it are baptized the sons of Hagar,—and are become gentle and peaceful.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:52
verses.text: Who has seen rams like these,—that are yoked, lo! and labour—along with tame bullocks,—and the seed of their tillage is reaped an hundredfold!  16.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:53
verses.text: In the beginning the Spirit that brooded—moved on the waters; they conceived and gave birth—to serpents and fishes and birds.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:54
verses.text: —The Holy Spirit has brooded in Baptism,—and in mystery has given birth to eagles,—Virgins and Prelates;—and in mystery has given birth to fishes,—celibates and intercessors; and in mystery of serpents,—lo! the subtle have become simple as doves!  17.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:55
verses.text: Lo! the sword of our Lord in the waters!—that which divides sons and fathers:—for it is the living sword that makes—division, lo! of the living from the dying.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:56
verses.text: —Lo! they are baptized and they become—Virgins and saints,—who have gone down, been baptized, and put on—the One Only begotten.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:57
verses.text: —Lo! many have come boldly to Him!  18.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:58
verses.text: For whoso have been baptized and put on Him—the Only begotten the Lord of the many,—has filled thereby the place of many,—for to him Christ has become a great treasure:—for He became in the wilderness—a table of good meats,—and He became at the marriage feast—a fountain of choice wines.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:59
verses.text: —He has become such to all in all things,—by helps and healings and promises.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:60
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:61
verses.text: Elisha was the equal of the Watchers—in his doings, glorious and holy.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:62
verses.text: —The camp of the Watchers was round about him;—thus let Baptism be unto you,—a camp of guardians,—for by means of it there dwells in the heart—the hope of them that are below—and the Lord of them that are above.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:63
verses.text: —Sanctify for Him your bodies,—for where He abides, corruption comes not near.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:64
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:65
verses.text: They are no more, the waters of that sea—which by its billows preserved the People,—and by its billows laid low the peoples.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:66
verses.text: —Of contrary effect are the waters in Baptism.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:67
verses.text: —In them, lo! the people have life;—in them, lo! the People perishes:—for all that are not baptized,—in the waters that give life to all,—they are dead invisibly.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:68
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:69
verses.text: They are no more, the waters of that sea—which were tempestuous, and boiled against Jonah,—and plunged into the depths the Son of Amittai.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:70
verses.text: —Though he fled he was bound in the prison-house;—God cast him in and bound him—in dungeon within dungeon;—for he bound him in the sea.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:71
verses.text: —and He bound him in the fish.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:72
verses.text: —For him Grace stood surety,—and she opened the prison and brought forth the preacher.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:73
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:74
verses.text: The Prophets have called the Most High a fire,—"a devouring fire," and "who can dwell with it?"—The People were not able to dwell in it;—its might crushed the peoples and they were confounded.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 8:75
verses.text: —In it, with the unction ye have been anointed;—ye have put Him on in the water;—in the bread ye have eaten Him;—in the wine ye have drunk Him;—in the voice ye have heard Him;—and in the eye of the mind ye have seen Him!.

chapters.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:1
verses.text: Hymn IX.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:2
verses.text: (Resp.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:3
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who came down, and sanctified water for the remission of the sins of the children of Adam!)  1.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:4
verses.text: O John, who sawest the Spirit,—that abode on the head of the Son,—to show how the Head of the Highest—went down and was baptized—and came up to be Head on earth!—Children of the Spirit ye have thus become,—and Christ has become for you the Head:—ye also have become His members.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:5
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:6
verses.text: Consider and see how exalted ye are;—how instead of the river Jordan—ye have glorious Baptism, wherein is peace;—spreading her wings to shade your bodies.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:7
verses.text: —In the wilderness John baptized:—in Her pure flood of Baptism,—purely are ye baptized therein.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:8
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:9
verses.text: Infants think when they see its glory,—that by its pomp its might is enhanced.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:10
verses.text: —But it is the same, and within itself—is not divided.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:11
verses.text: —But the might which never waxes less or greater—in us is little or again great;—and he in whom is great understanding,—great in him is Baptism.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:12
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:13
verses.text: A man's knowledge, if it be exalted,—exalted also is his degree above his brethren;—and he whose faith is great,—so also is his promise;—and as is his wisdom, so also his crowning.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:14
verses.text: —As is the light, which though it be all goodly—and equal all of it with itself,—yet goodlier is one eye than another.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:15
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:16
verses.text: Jesus mingled His might in the water:—put ye Him on my brethren as discerning men!—For there are that in the water merely—perceive that they are washed.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:17
verses.text: With our body be our soul washed!—The manifest water let the body perceive,—and the soul the secret might;—that both to the manifest and to the secret ye may be made like!  6.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:18
verses.text: How beautiful is Baptism—in the eye of the heart; come, let us gaze on it!—Like as by a seal ye have been moulded;—receive ye its image,—that nought may be lacking to us of our image!—For the sheep that are white of heart—gaze on the glory that is in the water:—in your souls reflect ye it!  7.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:19
verses.text: Water is by nature as a mirror,—for one who in it examines himself.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:20
verses.text: —Stir up thy soul, thou that discernest,—and be like unto it!—For it in its midst reflects thy image;—from it, on it, find an example;—gaze in it on Baptism,—and put on the beauty that is hidden therein!  8.
