verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:21
verses.text: What profits it him that hears—a voice and knows not its significance?—Whoso hears a voice and is devoid—of the understanding thereof,—his ear is filled but his soul is empty.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:22
verses.text: —Lo! since the gift is abundant,—with discernment receive ye it.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:23
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:24
verses.text: Baptism that is with understanding—is the conjunction of two lights,—and rich are the fountains of its rays.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:25
verses.text: —……—And the darkness that is on the mind departs,—and the soul beholds Him in beauty,—the hidden Christ of glory,—and grieves when the glory fails.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:26
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:27
verses.text: Baptism without understanding—is a treasure full yet empty;—since he that receives it is poor in it,—for he understands not—how great are its riches into which he enters and dwells.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:28
verses.text: —For great is the gift within it,—though the mean man perceives not—that he is exalted even as it.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:29
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:30
verses.text: Open wide your minds and see, my brethren,—the secret column in the air, whose base is fixed from the midst of the water—unto the door of the Highest Place, like the ladder that Jacob saw.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:31
verses.text: —Lo! by it came down the light unto Baptism,—and by it the soul goes up to Heaven,—that in one love we may be mingled.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:32
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:33
verses.text: Our Lord when he was baptized by John—sent forth twelve fountains;—and they issued forth and cleansed by their streams—the defilement of the peoples.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:34
verses.text: —His worshippers are made white like His garments,—the garments in Tabor and the body in the water.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:35
verses.text: —Instead of the garments the peoples are made white,—and have become for Him a clothing of glory.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:36
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:37
verses.text: From your garments learn, my brethren,—how your members should be kept.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:38
verses.text: —For if the garment, which ever so many times—may be made clean,—is duly kept for the sake of its comeliness,—the body which has but one baptism—manifold more exceeding is the care of its keeping,—for manifold are its dangers.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:39
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 9:40
verses.text: Again the sun in a house that is strait,—is straitened therein though he be great:—but in a house that is goodly and large,—when he rises thereon—far and wide in it he spreads his rays;—and though the sun is one and the same in his nature,—in divers houses he undergoes changes:—Even so our Lord in divers men.

chapters.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:1
verses.text: Hymn X.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:2
verses.text: (Resp.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:3
verses.text: —Glory to Him Who came and restored it!)  1.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:4
verses.text: Adam sinned and earned all sorrows;—likewise the world after His example, all guilt.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:5
verses.text: —And instead of considering how it should be restored,—considered how its fall should be pleasant for it.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:6
verses.text: —Glory to Him Who came and restored it!  2.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:7
verses.text: This cause summoned Him that is pure,—that He should come and be baptized, even He with the defiled,—Heaven for His glory was rent asunder.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:8
verses.text: —That the purifier of all might be baptized with all,—He came down and sanctified the water for our baptism.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:9
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:10
verses.text: For that cause for which He entered into the womb,—for the same cause He went down into the river.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:11
verses.text: —For that cause for which He entered into the grave,—for the same cause He makes us enter into His chamber.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:12
verses.text: —He perfected mankind for every cause.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:13
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:14
verses.text: His Conception is the store of our blessings;—His Birth is the treasury of our joys;—His Baptism is the cause of our pardon;—His Death is the cause of our life.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:15
verses.text: —Death He alone has overcome in His Resurrection.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:16
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:17
verses.text: At His Birth a star of light shone in the air;—when He was baptized light flashed from the water;—at His Death the sun was darkened in the firmament;—at His Passion the luminaries set along with Him;—at His Epiphany the luminaries arose with Him.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:18
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:19
verses.text: Revealed was His Glory because of His Majesty;—revealed was His Passion because of His Manhood;—revealed was His Love because of His Graciousness;—revealed was His Judgment because of His Justice.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:20
verses.text: —He has poured forth His attributes, on them that were His.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:21
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:22
verses.text: That whoso has looked on His Glory and despised Him,—may look again on His Glory and worship Him;—and whoso has scorned to taste of His Graciousness,—may fear lest he be made to feel His justice;—He has poured forth His helps on His worshippers.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:23
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:24
verses.text: Lo! the East in the morning was made light!—lo! the South at noonday was made dark!—The West again in turn at eventide was made light.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:25
verses.text: —The three quarters represent the one Birth;—His Death and His Life they declare.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:26
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:27
verses.text: His Birth flowed on and was joined to His Baptism;—and His Baptism again flowed on even to His Death;—His Death led and reached to His Resurrection,—a fourfold bridge unto His Kingdom; and lo! His sheep pass over in His footsteps.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:28
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:29
verses.text: And like as, save by the door of birth,—none can enter into creation;—so, save by the door of resurrection,—none can enter into the Kingdom,—and whoso has cut off his bridge, has brought to nought his hope.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:30
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:31
verses.text: He put on His armour and conquered and was crowned;—He left His armour on earth and ascended,—that if any man desires the crown,—he may resort to the armour and win by it—the crown of victory which he yearns after.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:32
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:33
verses.text: He fulfilled righteousness on earth, and ascended.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:34
verses.text: —But if He, the All-cleanser, was baptized,—What man is there that shall not be baptized?—for grace has come to baptism—to wash away the foulness of our wound.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:35
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:36
verses.text: The compulsion of God is an all-prevailing force;—[but that is not pleasing to Him which is of compulsion,]—as that which is of discerning will.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:37
verses.text: —Therefore in our fruits He calls us—who live not as under compulsion, by persuasion.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:38
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:39
verses.text: Good is He, for lo! He labours in these two things;—He wills not to constrain our freedom—nor again does He suffer us to abuse it.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:40
verses.text: —For had he constrained it, He had taken away its power;—and had He let it go, He had deprived it of help.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:41
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:42
verses.text: He knows that if He constrains He deprives us;—He knows that if He casts off He destroys us;—He knows that if He teaches He wins us.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:43
verses.text: —He has not constrained and He has not cast off, as the Evil One does:—He has taught, chastened, and won us, as being the good God.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:44
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:45
verses.text: He knows that His treasuries abound:—the keys of His treasuries He has put into our hands.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 10:46
verses.text: —He has made the Cross our treasurer—to open for us the gates of Paradise,—as Adam opened the gate of Gehenna.

chapters.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:1
verses.text: Hymn XI.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:2
verses.text: (Resp.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:3
verses.text: —Let the bodies rejoice which the Evil One had made naked, that in the water they have put on their glory!)  1.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:4
verses.text: Give thanks, O daughter, that thy crownings have been doubled;—for lo! thy temples and thy sons rejoice.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:5
verses.text: —The dedication of thy temples is in the ministration;—The dedication of thy sons is in the anointing.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:6
verses.text: —Blessed art thou that at once……—……the tabernacle for them that dwell in thee,—and the Spirit has abode upon thy sons!  2.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:7
verses.text: Our Lord opened up Baptism—in the midst of Jordan the blessed river.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:8
verses.text: —The height and the depth rejoiced in Him;—He brings forth the first fruits of His peace from the water,—for they are first fruits, the fruits of Baptism.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:9
verses.text: —The good God in His compassion will bring to pass—that His peace shall be first fruits on earth.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:10
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:11
verses.text: Moses stretched out the temporal Tabernacle;—the priests bathed themselves in water,—and went in and ministered; and were stricken and punished,—because their heart within was not cleansed.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:12
verses.text: —Blessed art thou that in the Passover of the great Passion,—the priests by the savour of their oblations,—lo! are cleansing souls in thee!  4.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:13
verses.text: Great was the mystery that the Prophet saw,—the torrent that was mighty.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:14
verses.text: —Into its depths he gazed and beheld—thy beauty instead of himself; thee it was he saw, for thy faith passes not away,—thou whose flood unseen shall overwhelm—the subtleties of idolatry.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:15
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:16
verses.text: Though John was great among them that are born of women,—yet he that is little is greater than he,—in this that his baptized were again baptized,—in the baptism that was of the Apostles.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:17
verses.text: —Blessed art thou that thy priest is greater than he—in this alone that forever—abides his baptism.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:18
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:19
verses.text: The baptism that was of Siloam—did not bring mercy to the man that was laid there—who for thirty and eight years awaited it,—for he was a respecter of the persons of the Levites.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:20
verses.text: —Blessed art thou that thy healing is in thee for all men,—and thy priests are devoted and ready—for all that are in need of thy help.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:21
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:22
verses.text: The Prophet healed the waters that were unwholesome,—and cured the disease of the land that was barren,—so that its death was done away and its region resounded, for its offspring increased and its bosom was filled.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:23
verses.text: —Greater is Thy grace, Lord, than Elisha's!—Multiply my lambs and my flocks—at the great stream of my fountain! 8.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:24
verses.text: Great is the marvel that is within thy abode;—the flocks together with the Shepherds,—those at the stream of the waters,—two unseen with one manifest who baptizes.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 11:25
verses.text: —Blessed is he who is baptized in their fountains!—for three arms have upheld him,—and three Names have preserved him!.

chapters.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:1
verses.text: Hymn XII.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:2
verses.text: (Resp.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:3
verses.text: —Blessed is He Who went down and was baptized in Jordan, and turned back the People from error!)  1.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:4
verses.text: In Baptism Adam found again—that glory that was among the trees of Eden.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:5
verses.text: —He went down, and received it out of the water;—he put it on, and went up and was adorned therein.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:6
verses.text: —Blessed be He that has mercy on all!  2.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:7
verses.text: Man fell in the midst of Paradise,—and in baptism compassion restored him:—he lost his comeliness through Satan's envy,—and found it again by God's grace.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:8
verses.text: —Blessed be He that has mercy on all!  3.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:9
verses.text: The wedded pair were adorned in Eden;—but the serpent stole their crowns:—yet mercy crushed down the accursed one,—and made the wedded pair goodly in their raiment.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:10
verses.text: —Blessed be He that has mercy on all!  4.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:11
verses.text: They clothed themselves with leaves of necessity;—but the Merciful had pity on their beauty,—and instead of leaves of trees,—He clothed them with glory in the water.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:12
verses.text: —Blessed be He that has mercy on all!  5.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:13
verses.text: Baptism is the well-spring of life,—which the Son of God opened by His Life;—and from His Side it has brought forth streams.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:14
verses.text: —Come, all that thirst, come, rejoice!—Blessed be He that has mercy on all!  6.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:15
verses.text: The Father has sealed Baptism, to exalt it;—and the Son has espoused it to glorify it;—and the Spirit with threefold seal—has stamped it, and it has shone in holiness.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:16
verses.text: —Blessed be He that has mercy on all!  7.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:17
verses.text: The Trinity that is unsearchable—has laid up treasures in baptism.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 12:18
verses.text: —Descend, ye poor, to its fountain!—and be enriched from it, ye needy!—Blessed be He that has mercy on all!.

chapters.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:1
verses.text: Hymn XIII.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:2
verses.text: Hymn of the Baptized.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:3
verses.text: (Resp.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:4
verses.text: —Brethren, sing praises, to the Son of the Lord of all; Who has bound for you crowns, such as kings long for!)  1.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:5
verses.text: Your garments glisten, my brethren, as snow;—and fair is your shining in the likeness of Angels!  2.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:6
verses.text: In the likeness of Angels, ye have come up, beloved,—from Jordan's river, in the armour of the Holy Ghost.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:7
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:8
verses.text: The bridal chamber that fails not, my brethren, ye have received:—and the glory of Adam's house to-day ye have put on.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:9
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:10
verses.text: The judgment that came of the fruit, was Adam's condemnation:—but for you victory, has arisen this day.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:11
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:12
verses.text: Your vesture is shining, and goodly your crowns:—which the Firstborn has bound for you, by the priest's hand this day.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:13
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:14
verses.text: Woe in Paradise, did Adam receive:—but you have received, glory this day.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:15
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:16
verses.text: The armour of victory, ye put on, my beloved:—in the hour when the priest, invoked the Holy Ghost.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:17
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:18
verses.text: The Angels rejoice, men here below exult:—in your feast, my brethren, wherein is no foulness.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:19
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:20
verses.text: The good things of Heaven, my brethren, ye have received:—beware of the Evil One, lest he despoil you.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:21
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:22
verses.text: The day when He dawned, the Heavenly King:—opens for you His door, and bids you enter Eden.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:23
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:24
verses.text: Crowns that fade not away, are set on your heads:—hymns of praise hourly, let your mouths sing.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:25
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:26
verses.text: Adam by means of the fruit, God cast forth in sorrow:—but you He makes glad, in the bride-chamber of joy.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:27
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:28
verses.text: Who would not rejoice, in your bridechamber, my brethren?—for the Father with His Son, and the Spirit rejoice in you.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:29
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:30
verses.text: Unto you shall the Father, be a wall of strength:—and the Son a Redeemer, and the Spirit a guard.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:31
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:32
verses.text: Martyrs by their blood, glorify their crowns:—but you our Redeemer, by His Blood glorifies.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:33
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:34
verses.text: Watchers and Angels, joy over the repentant:—they shall joy over you my brethren, that unto them ye are made like.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:35
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:36
verses.text: The fruit which Adam, tasted not in Paradise:—this day in your mouths, has been placed with joy.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:37
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:38
verses.text: Our Redeemer figured, His Body by the tree:—whereof Adam tasted not, because he had sinned.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:39
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:40
verses.text: The Evil One made war, and subdued Adam's house:—through your baptism, my brethren, lo! he is subdued this day.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:41
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:42
verses.text: Great is the victory, but to-day you have won:—if so be ye neglect not, you shall not perish, my brethren.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:43
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:44
verses.text: Glory to them that are robed, glory to Adam's house!—in the birth that is from the water, let them rejoice and be blessed!  22.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 13:45
verses.text: Praise to Him Who has robed, His Churches in glory!—glory to Him Who has magnified, the race of Adam's house.

chapters.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:1
verses.text: Hymn XIV.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:2
verses.text: Hymn concerning our Lord and John.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:3
verses.text: (Resp.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:4
verses.text: —Glory to Thee, my Lord, for Thee—with joy Heaven and earth worship!)  1.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:5
verses.text: My thought bore me to Jordan,—and I saw a marvel when there was revealed—the glorious Bridegroom who to the Bride—shall bring freedom and holiness.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:6
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:7
verses.text: I saw John filled with wonder,—and the multitudes standing about him,—and the glorious Bridegroom bowed down—to the Son of the barren that he might baptize Him.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:8
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:9
verses.text: At the Word and the Voice my thought marvelled:—for lo! John was the Voice;—our Lord was manifested as the Word, that what was hidden should become revealed.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:10
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:11
verses.text: The Bride was espoused but knew not—who was the Bridegroom on whom she gazed:—the guests were assembled, the desert was filled,—and our Lord was hidden among them.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:12
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:13
verses.text: Then the Bridegroom revealed Himself;—and to John at the voice He drew near:—and the Forerunner was moved and said of Him—"This is the Bridegroom Whom I proclaimed".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:14
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:15
verses.text: He came to baptism Who baptizes all,—and He showed Himself at Jordan.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:16
verses.text: —John saw Him and drew back,—deprecating, and thus he spake:—  7.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:17
verses.text: "How, my Lord, willest Thou to be baptized,—Thou Who in Thy baptism atonest all?—Baptism looks unto Thee;—shed Thou on it holiness and perfection?"  8.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:18
verses.text: Our Lord said "I will it so;—draw near, baptize Me that My Will may be done.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:19
verses.text: —Resist My Will thou canst not:—I shall be baptized of thee, for thus I will it".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:20
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:21
verses.text: "I entreat, my Lord, that I be not compelled,—for this is hard that Thou hast said to me,—'I have need that thou shouldst baptize Me;'—for it is Thou that with Thy hyssop purifiest all".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:22
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:23
verses.text: "I have asked it, and it pleases Me that thus it should be;—and thou, John, why gainsayest thou?—Suffer righteousness to be fulfilled,—and come, baptize Me; why standest Thou?"  11.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:24
verses.text: "How can one openly grasp—in his hands the fire that burns?—O Thou that art fire have mercy on me,—and bid me not come near Thee, for it is hard for me!"  12.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:25
verses.text: "I have revealed to Thee My Will; what questionest thou?—Draw near, baptize Me, and thou shalt not be burned.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:26
verses.text: —The bridechamber is ready; keep Me not back—from the wedding-feast that has been made ready".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:27
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:28
verses.text: "The Watchers fear and dare not—gaze on Thee lest they be blinded;—and I, how, O my Lord, shall I baptize Thee?—I am too weak to draw near; blame me not!"  14.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:29
verses.text: "Thou fearest; therefore gainsay not—against My Will in what I desire:—and Baptism has respect unto Me.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:30
verses.text: —Accomplish the work to which thou hast been called!"  15.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:31
verses.text: "Lo! I proclaimed Thee at Jordan—in the ears of the people that believed not and if they shall see Thee baptized of me,—they will doubt that Thou art the Lord".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:32
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:33
verses.text: "Lo! I am to be baptized in their sight,—and the Father Who sent Me bears witness of Me—that I am His Son and in Me He is well pleased,—to reconcile Adam who was under His wrath".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:34
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:35
verses.text: "It becomes, me, O my Lord, to know my nature—that I am moulded out of the ground,—and Thou the moulder Who formest all things:—I, then, why should I baptize Thee in water?"  18.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:36
verses.text: "It becomes thee to know wherefore I am come,—and for what cause I have desired that thou shouldst baptize Me.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:37
verses.text: —It is the middle of the way wherein I have walked;—withhold thou not Baptism".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:38
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:39
verses.text: "Small is the river whereto Thou art come,—that Thou shouldst lodge therein and it should cleanse Thee.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:40
verses.text: —The heavens suffice not for Thy mightiness;—how much less shall Baptism contain Thee!"  20.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:41
verses.text: "The womb is smaller than Jordan;—yet was I willing to lodge in the Virgin:—and as I was born from woman,—so too am I to be baptized in Jordan".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:42
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:43
verses.text: "Lo! the hosts are standing!—the ranks of Watchers, lo! they worship!—And if I draw near, my Lord, to baptize Thee,—I tremble for myself with quaking".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:44
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:45
verses.text: "The hosts and multitudes call thee happy,—all of them, for that thou baptizest Me.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:46
verses.text: —For this I have chosen thee from the womb:—fear thou not, for I have willed it.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:47
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:48
verses.text: "I have prepared the way as I was sent:—I have betrothed the Bride as I was commanded.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:49
verses.text: —May Thy Epiphany be spread over the world—now that Thou art come, and let me not baptize Thee!"  24.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:50
verses.text: "This is My preparation, for so have I willed;—I will go down and be baptized in Jordan,—and make bright the armour for them that are baptized,—that they may be white in Me and I not be conquered".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:51
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:52
verses.text: "Son of the Father, why should I baptize Thee?—for lo! Thou art in Thy Father and Thy Father in Thee.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:53
verses.text: —Holiness unto the priests Thou givest;—water that is common wherefore askest Thou?"  26.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:54
verses.text: "The children of Adam look unto Me,—that I should work for them the new birth.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:55
verses.text: —A way in the waters I will search out for them,—and if I be not baptized this cannot be".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:56
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:57
verses.text: "Pontiffs of Thee are consecrated,—priests by Thy hyssop are purified;—the anointed and the kings Thou makest.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:58
verses.text: —Baptism, how shall it profit Thee?"  28.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:59
verses.text: "The Bride thou betrothedst to Me awaits Me,—that I should go down, be baptized, and sanctify her.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:60
verses.text: —Friend of the Bridegroom withhold Me not—from the washing that awaits Me".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:61
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:62
verses.text: "I am not able, for I am weak,—Thy blaze in my hands to grasp.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:63
verses.text: —Lo! Thy legions are as flame;—bid one of the Watchers baptize Thee!"  30.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:64
verses.text: "Not from the Watchers was My Body assumed,—that I should summon a Watcher to baptize Me.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:65
verses.text: —The body of Adam, lo! I have put on,—and thou, son of Adam, art to baptize Me".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:66
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:67
verses.text: "The waters saw Thee, and greatly feared;—the waters saw Thee, and lo! they tremble!—The river foams in its terror;—and I that am weak, how shall I baptize Thee?"  32.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:68
verses.text: "The waters in My Baptism are sanctified,—and fire and the Spirit from Me shall they receive;—and if I be not baptized they are not made perfect—to be fruitful of children that shall not die".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:69
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:70
verses.text: "Fire, if to Thy fire it draw near,—shall be burnt up of it as stubble.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:71
verses.text: —The mountains of Sinai endured Thee not,—and I that am weak, wherein shall I baptize Thee?"  34.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:72
verses.text: "I am the flaming fire;—yet for man's sake I became a babe—in the virgin womb of the maiden.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:73
verses.text: —And now I am to be baptized in Jordan".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:74
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:75
verses.text: "It is very meet that Thou shouldst baptize me,—for Thou hast holiness to purify all.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:76
verses.text: —In Thee it is that the defiled are made holy; but Thou that art holy, why art Thou to be baptized?"  36.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:77
verses.text: "It is very right that thou shouldst baptize Me,—as I bid, and shouldst not gainsay.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:78
verses.text: —Lo! I baptized thee within the womb;—baptize thou me in Jordan!"  37.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:79
verses.text: "I am a bondman and I am weak.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:80
verses.text: —Thou that freest all have mercy on me! Thy latchets to unloose I am not able;—Thy exalted head who will make me worthy to touch?"  38.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:81
verses.text: "Bondmen in My Baptism are set free;—handwritings in My washing are blotted out;—manumissions in the water are sealed ;—and if I be not baptized all these come to nought".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:82
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:83
verses.text: "A mantle of fire the air wears,—and waits for Thee, above Jordan;—and if Thou consentest to it and willest to be baptized,—Thou shalt baptize Thyself and fulfil all".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:84
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:85
verses.text: "This is meet, that thou shouldst baptize Me,—that none may err and say concerning Me,—'Had He not been alien from the Father's house,—why feared the Levite to baptize Him?'"  41.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:86
verses.text: "The prayer, then, when Thou art baptized,—how shall I complete over Jordan?—When the Father and the Spirit are seen over Thee,—Whom shall I call on, as priest?"  42.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:87
verses.text: "The prayer in silence is to be completed:—come, thy hand alone lay thou on Me.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:88
verses.text: —and the Father shall utter in the priest's stead—that which is meet concerning His Son".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:89
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:90
verses.text: "They that are bidden, lo! all of them stand;—the Bridegroom's guests, lo! they bear witness—that day by day I said among them,—'I am the Voice and not the Word.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:91
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:92
verses.text: "Voice of him that cries in the wilderness,—fulfil thou the work for which thou camest,—that the desert whereunto thou wentest out may resound—with the mighty peace thou preachedst therein".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:93
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:94
verses.text: "The shout of the Watchers has come to my ears;—lo! I hear from the Father's house—the hosts that sound forth the cry,—'In Thy Epiphany, O Bridegroom, the worlds have life.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:95
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:96
verses.text: "The time hastes on, and the marriage guests—look to Me to see what is doing.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:97
verses.text: —Come, baptize Me, that they may give praise—to the Voice of the Father when it is heard!"  47.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:98
verses.text: "I hearken, my Lord, according to Thy Word:—come to Baptism as Thy love constrains Thee!—The dust worships that whereunto he has attained,—that on Him Who fashioned him he should lay his hand".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:99
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:100
verses.text: The heavenly ranks were silent as they stood,—and the Bridegroom went down into Jordan;—the Holy One was baptized and straightway went up,—and His Light shone forth on the world.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:101
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:102
verses.text: The doors of the highest were opened above,—and the voice of the Father was heard,—"This is my Beloved in Whom I am well pleased".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:103
verses.text: —All ye peoples, come and worship Him.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:104
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:105
verses.text: They that saw were amazed as they stood, at the Spirit Who came down and bare witness to Him.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 14:106
verses.text: —Praise to Thy Epiphany that gladdens all,—Thou in Whose revelation the worlds are lightened!.

chapters.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:1
verses.text: Hymn XV.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:2
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:3
verses.text: In the Birth of the Son light dawned,—and darkness fled from the world,—and the earth was enlightened; then let it give glory—to the brightness of the Father Who has enlightened it!  2.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:4
verses.text: He dawned from the womb of the Virgin,—and the shadows passed away when He was seen,—and the darkness of error was strangled by Him,—and the ends of the earth were enlightened that they should give glory.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:5
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:6
verses.text: Among the peoples there was great tumult,—and in the darkness the light dawned,—and the nations rejoiced to give glory—to Him in Whose Birth they all were enlightened.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:7
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:8
verses.text: His light shone out over the east;—Persia was enlightened by the star:—His Epiphany gave good tidings to her and invited her,—"He is come for the sacrifice that brings joy to all".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:9
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:10
verses.text: The star of light hasted and came and dawned—through the darkness, and summoned them—that the peoples should come and exult—in the great Light that has come down to earth.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:11
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:12
verses.text: One envoy from among the stars—the firmament sent to proclaim to them,—to the sons of Persia, that they might make ready—to meet the King and to worship Him.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:13
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:14
verses.text: Great Assyria when she perceived it—called to the Magi and said to them,—"Take gifts and go, honour Him—the great King Who in Judea has dawned".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:15
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:16
verses.text: The princes of Persia, exulting,—carried gifts from their region;—and they brought to the Son of the Virgin—gold and myrrh and frankincense.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:17
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:18
verses.text: They entered and found Him as a child—as He dwelt in the house of the lowly woman;—and they drew near and worshipped with gladness,—and brought near before Him their treasures.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:19
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:20
verses.text: Mary said, "For whom are these?—and for what purpose? and what is the cause—that has called you to come from your country—to the Child with your treasures?"  11.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:21
verses.text: They said, "Thy Son is a King,—and He binds crowns and is King of all;—and great is His power over the world,—and to His Kingdom shall all be obedient".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:22
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:23
verses.text: "At what time did this come to pass,—that a lowly woman should bring forth a King? I who am in need and in want,—how then could a king come forth from me?"  13.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:24
verses.text: "In thee alone has this come to pass—that a mighty King from thee should appear;—thee in whom poverty shall be magnified,—and to thy Son shall crowns be made subject".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:25
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:26
verses.text: "Treasures of Kings I have not;—riches have never fallen to my lot.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:27
verses.text: —My house is lowly and my dwelling needy;—why then proclaim ye that my Son is King?"  15.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:28
verses.text: "Great treasure is in thy Son,—and wealth that suffices to make all rich;—for the treasures of kings are impoverished,—but He fails not nor can be measured".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:29
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:30
verses.text: "Whether haply some other be for you—the King that is born, enquire ye concerning Him.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:31
verses.text: —This is the son of a lowly woman,—of one who is not meet to look on a King".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:32
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:33
verses.text: "Can it be that light should ever miss—the way whereon it has been sent? It was not darkness that summoned and led us;—in light we walked, and thy Son is King".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:34
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:35
verses.text: "Lo! ye see a babe without speech,—and the house of His mother empty and needy,—and of that which pertains to a king nought is in it:—how then in it is a king to be seen?"  19.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:36
verses.text: "Lo! we see that without speech and at rest—is the King, and lowly as thou hast said:—but again we see that the stars—in the highest He bids haste to proclaim Him".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:37
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:38
verses.text: "It were meet, O men, that ye should enquire—who is the King, and then adore him;—lest haply your way has been mistaken,—and another is the King that is born".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:39
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:40
verses.text: "It were meet, O maiden, that thou shouldst receive it,—that we have learned that thy Son is King,—from the star of light that errs not,—and plain is the way, and he has led us".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:41
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:42
verses.text: "The Child is a little one, and lo! he has not—the diadem of a king and of a throne;—and what have ye seen that ye should pay honour to Him,—as to a king, with your treasures?"  23.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:43
verses.text: "A little one, because He willed it for quietness' sake,—and meek now until He be revealed.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:44
verses.text: —A time shall be for Him when all diadems—shall bow down and worship Him".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:45
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:46
verses.text: "Armies he has none;—nor has my Son legions and troops:—in the poverty of His mother He dwells;—why then King is He called by you?"  25.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:47
verses.text: "The armies of thy Son are above;—they ride on high, and they flame,—and one of them it was that came and summoned us,—and all our country was dismayed".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:48
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:49
verses.text: "The Child is a babe, and how is it possible—He should be King, unknown to the world?—And they that are mighty and of renown,—how can a babe be their ruler?"  27.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:50
verses.text: "Thy babe is aged, O Virgin,—and Ancient of Days and exalted above all and Adam beside Him is very babe,—and in Him all created things are made new".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:51
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:52
verses.text: "It is very seemly that ye should expound—all the mystery and explain it;—who it is that reveals to you the mystery of my Son,—that He is a King in your region".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:53
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:54
verses.text: "It is likewise seemly for thee to accept this,—that unless the truth had led us we had not wandered hither from the ends of the earth,—nor come for the sake of thy Son".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:55
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:56
verses.text: "All the mystery as it was wrought—among you there in your country,—reveal ye to me now as friends.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:57
verses.text: —Who was He that called you to come to me?"  31.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:58
verses.text: "A mighty Star appeared to us—that was glorious exceedingly above the stars,—and our land by its fire was kindled;—that this King had appeared it bore tidings to us".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:59
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:60
verses.text: "Do not, I beseech you, speak of—these things in our land lest they rage,—and the kings of the earth join together—against the Child in their envy".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:61
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:62
verses.text: "Be not thou dismayed, O Virgin!—Thy Son shall bring to nought all diadems, and set them underneath his heel;—and they shall not subdue Him Whom they envy".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:63
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:64
verses.text: "Because of Herod I am afraid,—that unclean wolf, lest he assail me,—and draw his sword and with it cut off—the sweet cluster before it be ripe".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:65
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:66
verses.text: "Because of Herod fear thou not;—for in the hands of thy Son is his throne placed:—and as soon as He shall reign it shall be laid low,—and his diadem shall fall on the earth beneath".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:67
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:68
verses.text: "A torrent of blood is Jerusalem,—wherein the excellent ones are slain;—and if she perceives Him she will assail Him.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:69
verses.text: —In mystery speak ye, and noise it not abroad".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:70
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:71
verses.text: "All torrents, and likewise swords,—by the hands of thy Son shall be appeased;—and the sword of Jerusalem shall be blunted,—and shall not desire at all to kill".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:72
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:73
verses.text: "The scribes of the priests of Jerusalem—pour forth blood and heed not.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:74
verses.text: —They will arouse murderous strife—against me and against the Child; O Magi, be silent!"  39.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:75
verses.text: "The scribes and the priests will be unable—to hurt thy son in their envy;—for by Him their priesthood shall be dissolved,—and their festivals brought to nought".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:76
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:77
verses.text: "A Watcher revealed to me, when I received—conception of the Babe, that my Son is a King;—that His diadem is from on high and is not dissolved,—he declared to me even as ye do".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:78
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:79
verses.text: "The Watcher, therefore, of whom thou hast spoken—is he who came as a star,—and was shown to us and brought us good tidings—that He is great and glorious above the stars".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:80
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:81
verses.text: "That Angel declared to me—in his good tidings, when he appeared to me,—that to His Kingdom no end shall be—and the mystery is kept and shall not be revealed".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:82
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:83
verses.text: "The Star also declared again to us—that thy Son is He that shall keep the diadem.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:84
verses.text: —His aspect was something changed,—and he was the Angel and made it not known to us".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:85
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:86
verses.text: "Before me when the Watcher showed himself,—he called Him his Lord before He was conceived;—and as the Son of the Highest announced Him to me:—but where His Father is he made not known to me".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:87
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:88
verses.text: "Before us he proclaimed in the form of a star—that the Lord of the Highest is He Who is born;—and over the stars of light thy Son is ruler,—and unless He commands they rise not".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:89
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:90
verses.text: "In your presence, lo! there are revealed—other mysteries, that ye may learn the truth;—how in virginity I bare my Son,—and He is Son of God; go ye, proclaim Him!"  47.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:91
verses.text: "In our presence the Star taught us—that His Birth is exalted above the world and above all beings is thy Son,—and is Son of God according to thy saying".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:92
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:93
verses.text: "The world on high and the world below bear witness to Him,—all the Watchers and the stars,—that He is Son of God and Lord.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:94
verses.text: —Bear ye His fame to your lands!"  49.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:95
verses.text: "All the world on high, in one star,—has stirred up Persia and she has learnt the truth,—that thy Son is Son of God,—and to Him shall all peoples be subject".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:96
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:97
verses.text: "Peace bear ye to your lands:—peace be multiplied in your borders!—As apostles of truth may ye be believed—in all the way that ye shall pass through".

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:98
Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:99
verses.text: "The peace of thy Son, it shall bear us—in tranquillity to our land, as it has led us hither;—and when His power shall have grasped the worlds,—may He visit our land and bless it!  52.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:100
verses.text: "May Persia rejoice in your glad tidings!—may Assyria exult in your coming—And when my Son's Kingdom shall arise,—may He plant His standard in your country!"  53.

verses.name: Hymns for the Feast of the Epiphany 15:101
verses.text: Let the Church sing with rejoicing,—"Glory in the Birth of the Highest,—by Whom the world above and the world below are illumined!"—Blessed be He in Whose Birth all are made glad!.
